summary: Earl J. Williamson was a CIA employee, as evidenced by his official personnel folder which contains records of his employment including reassignments, performance evaluations, awards, and a letter commending his service on the Clandestine Service Personnel Evaluation Board. One document mentions him in connection to the AMBUD program, specifically related to dependency payments and survivor benefits at JMWAVE. The personnel folder is dated May 30, 1972, while the AMBUD program document is dated May 29, 1967. Another cable mentions AMCLEVE/15's contact with Frank "Lefty" Rosenthal, but Williamson's direct involvement in this event is not specified.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Earl J. Williamson's significance to the JFK assassination context is not explicitly stated. His CIA employment and involvement in programs like AMBUD, as well as his connection to individuals like Frank "Lefty" Rosenthal through AMCLEVE/15, might warrant further investigation to determine if there is any relevance to the JFK assassination.
